tit.e: Rikkenseitai no Shosho (An imperial edict for the establishment of the constitutional system of government)
tit.cmt: ＊「立憲政体の詔書」は定訳不明でした。ローマ字表記の後に括弧つきで意訳といたしました。
tit.e: Rikkenseitai no Shosho (An imperial edict for the establishment of the constitutional system of government)
Rikkenseitai no Shosho (An imperial edict for the establishment of the constitutional system of government)

sen.j: 立憲政体の詔書（りっけんせいたいのしょうしょ）は、1875年（明治8年）4月14日に明治天皇が発した詔書。
sen.e: Rikkenseitai no Shosho was issued by the Emperor Meiji on April 14, 1875.
Rikkenseitai no Shosho was issued by the Emperor Meiji on April 14, 1875.
Rikkenseitai no Shosho was issued by the Emperor Meiji on April 14, 1875.

sen.j: 五箇条の御誓文の趣旨を拡充して、元老院 (日本)・大審院・地方官会議を設置し、段階的に立憲政体を立てることを宣言した。
sen.e: The Shosho (the imperial edict, decree) declared that the aim of the Charter Oath of Five Articles would be expanded to permit setting up of Genroin (Senate) (Japan), Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan), and Chihokan Kaigi (assembly of prefectural governors), in order to establish the constitutional system of government gradually.
sen.cmt: ＊五箇条のご誓文は大きく2つの表現があるようですが、用語集の登録を吟味しCharter Oath of Five Articlesにいたしました。＊「元老院」は用語集にthe Genroin (Senate)との登録があり、そちらに合わせました。「元老院」の直後にある「日本」は意味がよくわからず、ローマのものと区別するためかと思われましたが、直訳でJapanとのみ記載いたしました。＊地方官会議は、3つの対訳が用語登録されており、どれが定訳かは不明でしたため、ローマ字記載と括弧つきの意訳で登録されている用語を使用いたしました。
sen.e: The Shosho (the imperial edict, decree) declared that the aim of the Charter Oath of Five Articles would be expanded to permit setting up of Genroin (Senate) (Japan), Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan), and Chihokan Kaigi (assembly of prefectural governors), in order to establish the constitutional system of government gradually.

sen.j: 元老院、大審院、地方官会議ヲ設置シ漸時立憲政体樹立ノ詔勅、漸次立憲政体樹立の詔勅、元老大審二院を置くの詔などとも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Rikkenseitai no Shosho is also known as Genroin Daishin-in Chihokan Kaigi wo secchi shi Zenji Rikkenseitai Juritsu no Shochoku (An imperial edict for the gradual establishment of the constitutional system of government with setting up of Genroin, Daishin-in, and Chihokan Kaigi), Zenji Rikkenseitai Juritsu no Shochoku (An imperial edict for the gradual establishment of the constitutional system of government), or Genrou Daisin Niin wo oku no Mikotonori (An imperial edict for the setting up of two Houses, Genrouin and Daishin-in).
sen.cmt: ＊三つの詔 「元老院、大審院、地方官会議ヲ設置シ漸時立憲政体樹立ノ詔勅、漸次立憲政体樹立の詔勅、元老大審二院を置くの詔」はそれぞれ定訳が不明でしたので意訳といたしました（名前が長く、ローマ字表記をすべきか迷いましたが一応行っております）。
sen.e: It is also known as Genroin Daishin-in Chihokan Kaigi wo secchi shi Zenji Rikkenseitai Juritsu no Shochoku (An imperial edict for the gradual establishment of the constitutional system of government with setting up of Genroin, Daishin-in, and Chihokan Kaigi), Zenji Rikkenseitai Juritsu no Shochoku (An imperial edict for the gradual establishment of the constitutional system of government), or Genrou Daisin Niin wo oku no Mikotonori (An imperial edict for the setting up of two Houses, Genrouin and Daishin-in).

sen.j: 1875年（明治8年）1月から2月にかけての大阪会議において、明治政府の大久保利通・伊藤博文と、在野の木戸孝允・板垣退助・井上馨らとの間で合意が成立し、木戸・板垣の政府復帰と政治体制の改革が約束された。
sen.e: In the Osaka conference held from January to February in 1875, Toshimichi OKUBO and Hirobumi ITO who were working for the Meiji Government reached an agreement with Takayoshi KIDO, Taisuke ITAGAKI, and Kaoru INOUE who were out of power, and it was promised that KIDO and ITAGAKI would return to the government and the political system would be reformed.

sen.cmt: 苗字だけの場合は小文字に修正しました。it was promised～をit promised～として文を修正しました。
sen.e: In the Osaka conference held from January to February in 1875, Toshimichi OKUBO and Hirobumi ITO who were working for the Meiji Government reached an agreement with Takayoshi KIDO, Taisuke ITAGAKI, and Kaoru INOUE who were out of power, and it promised the return to the govenment for Kido and Itagak and the reform in political system.

sen.j: 同年3月、木戸・板垣は参議に復帰すると、大久保・伊藤とともに大阪会議の合意事項に基づいた政体改革案を作成し、太政大臣三条実美に提出した。
sen.e: In March 1875, after KIDO and ITAGAKI returned to the positions of Sangi (councillors), they drew up a political reform plan together with OKUBO and ITO based on the agreement in the Osaka conference, and then, submitted the plan to Sanetomi SANJO who was the Daijo-daijin (the Grand Minister).
sen.cmt: ＊「参議」は用語集を参照いたしました。＊「政体改革案」は定訳不明にて political reform planとの意訳にいたしました。
sen.e: In March of the same year, after Kido and Itagaki returned to the positions of Sangi (councillors), they drew up a political reform plan together with Okubo and Ito based on the agreement in the Osaka conference, and then submitted the plan to Sanetomi SANJO, the Daijo-daijin (the Grand Minister).
sen.cmt: 苗字だけの場合は小文字に修正しました。1875→the same yearとして、who was、コンマを除き修正しました。
sen.e: In March of the same year, after Kido and Itagaki returned to the positions of Sangi (councillors), they drew up a political reform plan together with Okubo and Ito based on the agreement in the Osaka conference, and then submitted the plan to Sanetomi SANJO, the Daijo-daijin (the Grand Minister).

sen.j: そして、4月14日、この政体改革案を元にした文書が、明治天皇の詔書の形で発表された。
sen.e: Then, on April 14, a Monjo (written material), which was prepared based on the political reform plan, was announced as a Shosho by the Emperor Meiji.
